name: Shrimp and Sugar Pea Pasta
author: Shyla Lane
summary: A simple and delicious pasta that also doubles as a nice way to eat your veggies, such as snap peas. Serve with garlic bread and you have yourself a nice, light, refreshing summer meal for two!
ingredients: ¼ pound fresh sugar snap peas
12  uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook linguine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes
Reserve 2 tablespoons cooking water and drain pasta
Heat olive oil and chile oil over medium heat in a deep, large pan
Cook shallot and garlic in the hot oil until softened and aromatic, 2 to 3 minutes
Add sugar snap peas and bell pepper; continue cooking until peas start to soften, about 5 minutes
Pour wine into the pan and cook until reduced slightly, 5 to 7 minutes
Combine reserved pasta water and cornstarch in a bowl until starch has dissolved and stir into wine with paprika
Return vegetables to the pan and add shrimp
Cook shrimp until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 3 to 4 minutes
Stir in pasta, butter, lemon juice, and basil until everything is coated and butter has melted
